intro: Flemingia kerrii, commonly known as the Kerri’s flemingia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has palmately compound leaves, with each leaflet being ovate to elliptical in shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
